question: How is pension calculated?
option1: 50% of emoluments (last pay) or average emoluments, whichever is more beneficial to the retiring Govt.
option2: 70% of emoluments (last pay) or average emoluments, whichever is more beneficial to the retiring
option3: 20% of emoluments (last pay) or average emoluments, whichever is more beneficial to the retiring Govt.
answer: 50% of emoluments (last pay) or average emoluments, whichever is more beneficial to the retiring Govt.
explanation: The amount of pension you receive is determined by years of service, age in which you elect to start collecting, and usually the average annual income over your last several years of service.
